title: Adding and Subtracting Matrices
text: Given matrices A and B of like dimensions, addition and subtraction of A and B will produce matrix C or matrix D of the same dimension. $$A+B=C$$ such that $$a_{i,j}+b_{i,j}=c_{i,j}$$ $$A-B=D$$ such that $$a_{i,j}-b_{i,j}=d_{i,j}$$

title: Adding Corresponding Entries
text: Since the dimension of the matrices are the same, we perform matrix addition $$A+B=C$$ such that $$a_{i,j}+b_{i,j}=c_{i,j}$$.

title: Adding Corresponding Entries
text: We will start by adding the top left entry of C, $$c_{1,1}$$, and D, $$d_{1,1}$$. What is $$c_{1,1}+d_{1,1}$$?

title: Adding Corresponding Entries
text: We will next add the top right entry of C, $$c_{1,2}$$, and D, $$d_{1,2}$$. What is $$c_{1,2}+d_{1,2}$$?

title: Adding Corresponding Entries
text: Repeat the same process for each corresponding entries to compute the addition of the two matrices.
